data.prayer: Spirit, make the church in Talas, Kyrgyzstan humble and willing to hear the sometimes hard voices of prophets bringing the light of truth on them.
data.verse: So have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Talas, Kyrgyzstan

data.prayer: Jesus, you taught Paul to train Timothy to train faithful men who would train others. Please, teach the church of Talas, Kyrgyzstan to do the same.
data.verse: And the things you have heard me say in the presence of many witnesses entrust to reliable people who will also be qualified to teach others.

data.prayer: Jesus, help the local leaders in Talas, Kyrgyzstan not be proud but humble, and willing to wash the feet of all they serve.
data.verse: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am. Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another’s feet. I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.

data.prayer: Lord, the believers in the state of Talas, Kyrgyzstan need teachers who can feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up.
data.verse: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

data.prayer: Jesus, I pray that all the Chinese, general people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Chinese, general people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Chinese, general people is yours.
Spirit, please convict the believers in Talas, Kyrgyzstan to not assume the ministry is for professional clergy, but for all who have been called by you.
Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the state of Talas.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.prayer: Father, reveal yourself to a faithful non-believer today, someone like Cornelius, and then Father please connect him with the church in Talas, Kyrgyzstan.
data.verse: Cornelius answered: “Three days ago I was in my house praying at this hour, at three in the afternoon. Suddenly a man in shining clothes stood before me and said, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor."

location.name: Talas
location.people_groups_list: Lezgin, Azerbaijani, Pashtun, Northern, Hemshin, Tajik
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Lezgin (2,700), Azerbaijani (22,000), Pashtun, Northern (600), Hemshin (1,100), Tajik (55,000)
